alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 21 at 3:05AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT/10 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Kansas, including the following counties, Greeley and Wichita. * WHEN...Until 900 AM MDT Friday /1000 AM CDT Friday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 202 AM MDT /302 AM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leoti, Tribune, Horace, Selkirk, Lydia and Marienthal. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
